intro: Lemboglossum cervantesii f. lilacinum, commonly known as the lilac-flowered lemboglossum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive lilac-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing adaptations to the harsh environmental conditions of its native region. Its foliage is generally narrow and grass-like, with small, tightly packed leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
